metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4171 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
mm/shmem.c in the Linux kernel through 3.15.1 does not properly implement the interaction between range notification and hole punching, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (i_mutex hold) by using the mmap system call to access a hole, as demonstrated by interfering with intended shmem activity by blocking completion of (1) an MADV_REMOVE madvise call or (2) an FALLOC_FL_PUNCH_HOLE fallocate call. Sasha Levin reported an issue with the Linux kernel's shared memory subsystem when used with range notifications and hole punching. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
